DOCNAME: CASE OF NIKOLIĆ AND OTHERS v. SERBIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Enforcement proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time);Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property (Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Peaceful enjoyment of possessions)
JUDGES: Branko Lubarda;Georgios A. Serghides;Pere Pastor Vilanova
TEXT: CARDINAL . In DATE the ORG predecessors were deprived of certain land in favour of the ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered ORG ( the debtor ) , a company predominantly comprised of socially - owned capital , as the end user of that land , to pay the applicants specified amounts on account of the compensation for the land in question .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE respectively , upon the ORG request to that effect , ORG ordered the enforcement of the said judgment and further ordered the debtor to pay the applicants the enforcement costs . This judgment became both , final and enforceable by DATE .
CARDINAL . CARDINAL applicant , Mr PERSON , never lodged an enforcement request .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Niš Commercial Court opened insolvency proceedings in respect of the debtor ( CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . CARDINAL applicant , PERSON Nikolić Jajčević , duly submitted her claims therein .
CARDINAL . These insolvency proceedings are still ongoing .
CARDINAL . NORP On DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE respectively , all applicants lodged their constitutional appeals .

CARDINAL . On DATE , DATE and CARDINAL DATE , respectively , the ORG found a violation of the right to a hearing within a reasonable time in respect of all applicants , except Mr PERSON . However , the court did not award the applicants any damages , merely stating that the applicants “ had not claimed non - pecuniary damages ” .
CARDINAL . ORG dismissed the appeal in respect of CARDINAL applicant , PERSON PERSON , since he had failed to request enforcement of the judgment in question .
